To close the project in UPSA Project Manager has to create and submit Project Closure Request in UPSA. Project Closure Request should be approved by Project Sponsor to launch Project Closure Procedure. Project Closure Procedure is performed using project closure checklist in UPSA that includes several closure items. Project closure items should be approved by responsible employees and include CTC clean-up (closure of all CTC items related to the Project) that is approved by WFA Cost Tracking and several technical items (e.g. closure of quality issues, customer satisfaction survey, archiving of project information, removal of software and hardware from the project, etc.).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"When all Project Closure items are approved the Project is automatically set to “Closed” status in UPSA. “Closed” status means that the project has been complete and no further time or expenditure postings can be made to it.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"UPSA also allows to set projects to “On hold” status. The system monitors the Project End Date and when it becomes due, the Project is automatically moved to status 'On Hold'. All positions in Resource Plan of project are moved to On Hold state too. Such status can be also set by PM/AM and means that the project has been temporarily suspended but not complete.
